caption.p:
Predicted viral rebound and persistence under different scenarios. We use the fitting to the URT viral load data of patient #3 in [14], [54] as an example to study viral rebound and persistence with different assumptions. (A) Predicted viral dynamics with different values of
σ
, the parameter determining how fast the death rate of infected cells increases as the adaptive immune response emerges. (B) Predicted viral rebound and persistence assuming the adaptive immune response is activated on day 9, 15, 20 and 25, respectively. The parameter
σ
is fixed to be 0.03 day −1.
